com.sri.ai.grinder.sgdpllt.api

Interface StepSolver.Step<T>

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    ExpressionLiteralSplitterStepSolver.Step, ExpressionStepSolver.Step, LiteralSplitterStepSolver.Step<T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ExpressionLiteralSplitterStepSolver.ItDependsOn, ExpressionLiteralSplitterStepSolver.Solution, ExpressionStepSolver.ItDependsOn, ExpressionStepSolver.Solution, LiteralSplitterStepSolver.ItDependsOn, LiteralSplitterStepSolver.Solution, StepSolver.ItDependsOn, StepSolver.Solution
    Enclosing interface:
    StepSolver<T>

    public static interface StepSolver.Step<T>
    A solver step of a StepSolver. If itDepends() returns true, the solution cannot be determined unless the context be restricted according to the splitter returned by getSplitter(). Otherwise, the expression returned by getValue() is the solution.
    Author:
    braz

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ContextSplitting getContextSplittingWhenSplitterIsLiteral()
      For solutions depending on a split, provides the constraint splitting for the context and splitter used, if available, or null otherwise.
      Expression getSplitter()
      If itDepends() is true, returns the splitter formula (e.g.
      StepSolver<T> getStepSolverForWhenSplitterIsFalse()
      Same as getStepSolverForWhenSplitterIsTrue() but for when splitter is false.
      StepSolver<T> getStepSolverForWhenSplitterIsTrue()
      Returns a StepSolver to be used for finding the final solution in case the splitter is defined as true by the context.
      T getValue()
      If itDepends() is false, returns the solution value.
      boolean itDepends() 

    • Method Detail

      • itDepends

        boolean itDepends()

      • getSplitter

        Expression getSplitter()
        If itDepends() is true, returns the splitter formula (e.g. a literal) the solution depends on.
        Returns:

      • getValue

        T getValue()
        If itDepends() is false, returns the solution value.
        Returns:

      • getStepSolverForWhenSplitterIsTrue

        StepSolver<T> getStepSolverForWhenSplitterIsTrue()
        Returns a StepSolver to be used for finding the final solution in case the splitter is defined as true by the context. This is merely an optimization, and using the original step solver should still work, but will perform wasted working re-discovering that expressions is already true.
        Returns:

      • getStepSolverForWhenSplitterIsFalse

        StepSolver<T> getStepSolverForWhenSplitterIsFalse()
        Same as getStepSolverForWhenSplitterIsTrue() but for when splitter is false.
        Returns:

      • getContextSplittingWhenSplitterIsLiteral

        ContextSplitting getContextSplittingWhenSplitterIsLiteral()
        For solutions depending on a split, provides the constraint splitting for the context and splitter used, if available, or null otherwise.
        Returns:
